dcterms:creator: Deepanway Ghosal
Siqi Shen
Navonil Majumder
Rada Mihalcea
Soujanya Poria
dcterms:description: CICERO is a dataset of dyadic conversations with five types of utterance-level reasoning-based inferences: cause, subsequent event, prerequisite, motivation, and emotional reaction. It contains 53,105 inferences from 5,672 dialogues, aimed at enabling models to operate effectively on dialogues by considering context and speculating when answers are not apparent.
dcterms:title: CICERO

dcterms:creator: M. Sap
R. Le Bras
E. Allaway
C. Bhagavatula
N. Lourie
H. Rashkin
B. Roof
N. A. Smith
Y. Choi
dcterms:description: ATOMIC is a dataset for commonsense reasoning-based inference, allowing for a large set of inference types. However, it is context-free, providing inferences on short phrases without considering the broader context.
dcterms:title: ATOMIC

dcterms:creator: N. Mostafazadeh
A. Kalyanpur
L. Moon
D. Buchanan
L. Berkowitz
O. Biran
J. Chu-Carroll
dcterms:description: GLUCOSE is a dataset that exclusively curates causal inferences from monologues. It is not ideal for making context-consonant inferences on dialogues, as it lacks dialogue-specific dimensions like motivation and reaction.
dcterms:title: GLUCOSE

dcterms:creator: Deepanway Ghosal
Pengfei Hong
Siqi Shen
Navonil Majumder
Rada Mihalcea
Soujanya Poria
dcterms:description: CIDER is a dataset for commonsense-based inference on dialogues, but it is limited to inferences explicitly observable in the dialogues, making it less effective for speculative inferences.
dcterms:title: CIDER

dcterms:creator: Y. Li
H. Su
X. Shen
W. Li
Z. Cao
S. Niu
dcterms:description: DailyDialog is a manually labelled multi-turn dialogue dataset covering a wide range of topics, with constituent utterances labelled with emotion and dialogue-act.
dcterms:title: DailyDialog

dcterms:creator: L. Cui
Y. Wu
S. Liu
Y. Zhang
M. Zhou
dcterms:description: MuTual is a dataset for multi-turn dialogue reasoning, where the objective is to predict the next utterance by considering aspects such as intent, attitude, algebraic, multi-fact, and situation reasoning.
dcterms:title: MuTual

dcterms:creator: K. Sun
D. Yu
J. Chen
D. Yu
Y. Choi
C. Cardie
dcterms:description: DREAM is a multiple-choice reading-comprehension dataset collected from exams of English as a foreign language, presenting significant challenges as many answers are non-extractive and require commonsense knowledge and multi-sentence reasoning.
dcterms:title: DREAM
